website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a soft and comfortable shirt that can keep you warm on even the coldest days, this thermal top is your best overall bet.
pros: This thermal top feels soft and luxurious against the skin thanks to its pointelle knit construction
Anti-microbial technology keeps odors at bay
cons: Snags and even small holes or tears can happen relatively easily, as this top is made from silk material

customer_reviews.title: Not silk at all.
customer_reviews.text: This product said it was 100% silk when I purchased it. When I got it, the label says it is cotton, model, spandex. It looks like the same product, it isn't 100% silk.
customer_reviews.author: David Washburn

customer_reviews.title: This is super light weight and was great at being not too ...
customer_reviews.text: This is super light weight and was great at being not too warm during the day but plenty warm at night after a 20 degree temperature drop. One thing to be aware of is that it is SHEER! The picture doesn't really show this so I was surprised. I was never planning for it to be my only layer, so it's not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jelly

customer_reviews.title: Thin, Lightweight, and Good Insulation
customer_reviews.text: I must have lucked out (after reading the bad reviews), because the quality of my Thermasilk is fine. It ran a bit large--the idea is it should be tight and go under other layers (though sometimes I put a small tank top under it). It's quite see-through and breeze-through, so its insulating power doesn't work unless something is worn over it. It's great for travel, weighs almost nothing and packs small. It kept me warm without bulkiness on a week long walking tour in February. If it got too hot it was easy to take off and store in a purse (especially with the small tank underneath it in case I had to remove it in public).
customer_reviews.author: Robinko

customer_reviews.title: Silk perfection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to replace one I've had for years. After an unfortunate accident in the drier, I needed a replacement. The item arrived today and was just as I had expected. Package indicated it was filament silk, which I had never heard of. I looked it up and found that filament silk is made from long threads and is superior to spun silk that is made from short threads. This item is soft and is perfect for wearing under thin sweaters or tops without adding bulk. Absolute perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Silk makes a great layer for the winter when you're wearing a cotton ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm allergic to wool and other animal hair so all my sweaters are cotton or synthetic. Silk makes a great layer for the winter when you're wearing a cotton sweater! These are thin enough not to add bulk, but they do help keep me warm. I have silk long sleeve and sleeveless undershirts in black and cream. My last black one (at least 15 years old!) finally fell apart from so much use and washing. This one was not disappointing. Machine wash cold. Probably best to hang to dry, but I prefer to dry on low with a fragrance-free dryer sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Gail D

customer_reviews.title: Doubt that this is even silk: tissue paper thin, rough, skimpy & way over-priced!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to buy another silk liner like one I have had for years which is silky smooth and keeps me warm. I don't know what this is made of or if there is any real silk in it. If so it was probably made of left over rough silk trimmings. It was also way too small ! Couldn't send it back fast enough!
customer_reviews.author: ZZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect layer for travel, office and sport!
customer_reviews.text: I am perpetually chilly with low blood pressure. This top is the perfect under-thing. It doesn't ride, it is super lightweight without bulk or folds under clothing and it is a perfect layer of warming. I love merino but 100% silk is unbeatably soft. When traveling, I can give this top a quick handwash/hang to dry and wear again in the morning to decrease laundering over-clothing. I'm 5'2" and #125-130 with midlife happening in all the usual places and a size medium is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Full Fat with All The Sugar

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I've bought silk underwear many times, and this stuff is cheap. Isn't soft, and is actually rough to the touch. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Long

customer_reviews.title: Super thin, cheap "silk".
customer_reviews.text: This fabric is as thin as pantyhose. I have seen tights made with thicker fabric. It was not a nice silk at all.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaGirl92054

customer_reviews.title: Thinner than I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I know that silk is expensive but it's my fabric of choice as a base layer in our Wisconsin winters. This is a bit pricey to me because it is not heavyweight silk. I'm a thin person living in an old, drafty house so I am always cold in the winter, even indoors. Hopefully this will suit me as well as my older silk underwear that shows wear and is getting a few runs. Silk also keeps the itch from wool sweaters off of my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Ceejay

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely loved those- can live without it in winter
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for that brand for years until I figured Amazon might have it. I absolutely loved those- can live without it in winter... Also, it is not too warm when wearing it indoor, so it is really the best product I found on the market
customer_reviews.author: Oren Saar

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a 100% silk undershirt and this one was better than I thought. I had an old Cabalas shirt that i loved. After looking for another one to replace, this one was so light weight, no bulk, and fit right against my body. It kept me warm in the cold morning weather. You will not be disapointed . Don't understand why some say it wasn't good. I love mine and will recommend this to others. Thank you Terramar!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome base layer
customer_reviews.text: Love this long underwear. It's my favorite and I'll buy it again it again. Just don't wash them in the washer, use Woolite and hand wash and it will last forever. I still have a top that I bought 15 years ago. They are warm and light weight/ thin and I will never use anything else when skiing.
customer_reviews.author: swindella

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this top (off-white) in 2018. It's 9 months later I just mistakenly washed it in hot water with my white towels & a bit of bleach & it came out with 2 large brown stains! The top also has a few holes (not sure if from bleach or were there already) I just wanted to say to be very careful taking care of silk pointelle as it should be handwashed & air-dried. I will buy again. The top is very soft & comfortable and a perfect first layer under my cashmere sweaters to keep me toasty warm!
customer_reviews.author: ToTellTheTruth

customer_reviews.title: they do not fit well and are annoying in the way they slid up to my ribs ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews before ordering. Other reviewers talked about the sizes being small and also that they ride up. I would consider myself a fairly normal shape and I have had similar tops before, but however these ones are cut, they do not fit well and are annoying in the way they slid up to my ribs although when I first put them on they are a reasonable length. I wish I had ordered a larger size and possibly a man's one. Every time I wear them I wish I had returned them instead of excitedly ripping off the plastic wrapper and putting them in my wardrobe. In terms of keeping me warm, they are sensational.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I was very please when I received this. I have had the "silk pointelle" type for years. (Usually purchased from LL Bean for much higher). It is beautiful, high quality and perfect weight for wearing under regular clothing without being restricting at all. Use gentle detergent and do not use fabric softener or the dryer on this as it will shorten the life of this delicate fabric. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: LaBreck

customer_reviews.title: Great Base Layer
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful base layer material that stands up to farm life and allows movement without leaving me feel "wet". For washing, I throw it in a large lingerie bag so I remember to hang it to dry - which doesn't take long, even in damp cold weather. This is my second set. My first set was purchased 3 years ago and still works fine - just needed a different size. Don't let the silk fool you - it's really sturdy! I do wish it were available in a v-neck style ( I know - who wears a v-neck in cold weather? I do with career wear and a office that runs a bit chilly.)
customer_reviews.author: EF39

customer_reviews.title: unbelievably warm
customer_reviews.text: This undergarment is one of the warmest I ever had. It is very thin, feels like a skin on your skin, and won't show even under a thin cashmere sweater of other light blouse. At first, when I received this item, I was not sure such a thin silk undergarment could actually keep me warm... but it really does! I went outside in frigid temperatures and felt just fine! This is an amazing thermal underwear, well worth paying the top price because it keeps you super warm without the bulky look of the other thick thermal under wears.
customer_reviews.author: N. Defontnouvelle

customer_reviews.title: Treat yourself to silk... you deserve it!
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer the men's version, for the style and different knit pattern. But these have held up well, silk is an amazing fabric. They are so thin, comfortable and lightweight that you might forget you are wearing them. They are definitely too thin to be worn on their own. But as a soft, warm under layer they are great. I wear them to bed all the time, even in the hot summer weather. I throw them in the washer and dryer with everything else, no problem. I highly recommend them, if you like the style. I just prefer the men's style.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Miller

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful top keeps you warm
customer_reviews.text: I can be very cold natured in the winter. I decided to give this product a try. I am glad that I did. This top is very light weight and not at all bulky. It holds in your body heat very well. I usually have to layer to stay warm. With this top I found myself taking extra layers off to be comfortable. I am thrilled with the performance of the shirt.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Very thin see through material
customer_reviews.text: This shirt doesn't look like the picture. It is very, very thin - see through - and doesn't seem like it would do much to keep you warm. I've gotten silk thermal underwear before and it was never nearly as thin.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Piaget

customer_reviews.title: Not for extremely cold temperatures
customer_reviews.text: This shirt will work if you are not going to be under 32F temperatures and even though you will need layers over it. The good Bing abou it is that is very thin and it won't b bulk under clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Robe

customer_reviews.title: Great base layer for Dec trip to NYC
customer_reviews.text: Hubby and I both got a set of these Thermasilk Filament layers for a Dec trip to NYC - these were perfect! These are thin, like slightly thicker than women's pantyhose, but that means that these easily fit under jeans and long sleeve tops. We both felt warm enough to endure late nights in the chilly wind (with coats and scarves obviously) but didn't feel too bulky or hot. Sizing was true for both of us - not skin tight like spandex but not baggy either. You can bend your limbs just fine. These are great baselayers for walking a winter city, but not thick enough for really braving the elements.
customer_reviews.author: JDinTucson

customer_reviews.title: Too Short for Tall Girl
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a fitted warm base layer. I can't attest to the warmth of this (it is very thin, but might be good as a bottom layer) because it was just too short in the sleeves and torso, so I returned it. I'm 5'11", 155 lbs, with long torso & arms and this was at least a couple inches shy of fitting (I got the medium) The fit around seemed ok, but it didn't have the length I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthy Every Penny and then some!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent material, fit, and quality. I purchased five pair. I have compared this set to other silk set and you just can't get better quality than Terramar. I have their socks and glove liners as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a busy office with people coming and going all day so it can get pretty drafty. I have several of these and wear them all winter. They’re very light weight with just enough give in the fabric to fit smoothly under clothes, yet keep me comfortably warm all day. If you’re a fan of layering, this is definitely for you. I highly recommend. They run a bit on the small side, so if you’re unsure, go a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Not what you were expecting
customer_reviews.text: The product was nicely made but it had a pool in it when we got it. It is very see-through. So I can imagine it would be warm at all. I'm sorry but I don't recommend buying this if you're looking for something warm cuz this is not it it is see through
customer_reviews.author: docdave602

customer_reviews.title: thin and warm
customer_reviews.text: thin and warm. Last time I bought them than ran a little large, this time they seemed to run a little small. Would give it a 5 star review but of the two I bought, I washed on gentle cycle and air dried and white one got a snag and tore a large hole across the front. This didn't happen with the black pants or tops. ? flawed material. Still wearing it since it goes under clothes and no one sees it.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen W.

customer_reviews.title: snug
customer_reviews.text: The Terramar Thermasilk are very nice and provide a great cold weather base layer. From my perspective the pure silk ones are the best. Once spandex is added it makes the product snug and in some brands really hard to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Little

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This product is low quality and disappointing. The fabric is very thin and whenever I put it on, I think it is going to tear. I have had silk undershirts before so I know what to expect. This is just too cheaply made. Also, the silk is not soft - it is somewhat rough. On the plus side it does fit as expected and it does keep you warm.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieQzzz

customer_reviews.title: Terramar Women's Thermasilk Scoop-Neck Top
customer_reviews.text: Supreme! I love this Thermal silk. It fits well and will stretch easily when I move. I am a size petite so I was concerned about it fitting, but I am over joyed with my purchase. It is warm and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Debby Leverett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This Thermasilk top is exactly what I was looking for. I especially like the scoop-neck, keeping the neckline from showing under other clothes. The fabric is of excellent quality and is very soft. I normally wear a medium but due to other reviews I ordered a large. The large is perfect. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly warm!
customer_reviews.text: These are SO lightweight that I didn't seriously think they'd be warm. Superior wicking as well. I have 4 now and that's still not enough! The v-neck doesn't show beneath most of my clothes. I usually wear them for skiing, but they are nice under work clothing too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly thin
customer_reviews.text: Extremely thin, like as sheer as pantyhose but more comfortable with a slightly more substantial weave. I don't undestand where the insulating factor is supposed to come in...it's just so lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: VERY SMALL FIT
customer_reviews.text: Order above your normal size. & if you have hips, forget it! appears to be a very nice fabric weight & soft. no reason to believe it would not be yummy warm under other clothing.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnna Nicolaisen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely will buy again, if I need to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the matching leggings for a Winter trip to Germany, and it was the best purchase! I continue to wear them as PJ's during the cold Winter nights here in the states, so they're constantly in the wash -- they haven't lost their shape, nor did they 'pil' up or shrink. I found both the tops and bottoms to be true to size, too.
customer_reviews.author: LC from Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: I really like this base layer
customer_reviews.text: I liked this base layer so much I bought a second one. It's more durable than you'd expect given how sheer the fabric is. The elbows are a little nubbed up from...well, elbow contact with chair arms and such, but that's easily avoided by wearing this under a long sleeve shirt. It feels very luxurious for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made-Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Wore once, fibers just split. I put them on CAREFULLY, (like nylons), and was trying the correct size. Sending them back for refund. I'll keep searching.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Marie

customer_reviews.title: Warm base layer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an under layer for cold weather traveling. It's a see-through, fitted top and fits true to size (I'm usually a medium with a 36.5-37" bust and the medium fit perfectly). My torso's on the shorter side and I'm glad this was not super long on me. It will keep me warm under another top. I liked the pric for this item compared to other brands I've tried that don't fit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great undershirt for winter weather
customer_reviews.text: I get cold in the office at work, and have found that I need some sort of undergarment; I am usually fine with a tank-style shirt, but there are times when I want something with more coverage that doesn't bulk up the sleeves--this fits the ticket perfectly! I am 5'6", 130 lbs, and I got the size small; it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: jldnh

customer_reviews.title: Two sizes small
customer_reviews.text: Ran two sizes small. Never reached anyone for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Jensmore

customer_reviews.title: Nothing else will do
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else compares to these for the price! I had a 20 year old pair that was finally falling apart, found some inexpensive "micro-fiber" ones, but was NOT happy with them. Searched these out online, and have been very content since. They re super thin, so they fit under clothes that already might be a little tight, and they breathe, so you don't get over heated. Nothing else like them for that extra layer for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: fruity gal

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable - very sheer though
customer_reviews.text: If this was more opaque it would have gotten 5 stars. Lovely in all other aspects. If you're ok with layers or your bra showing through, you'll like these!
customer_reviews.author: Nutrition Nut

customer_reviews.title: So thin and delicate that it’s ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: I have pantyhose thicker than this top. I was shocked to take it out of the package. I think I snagged it by breathing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dahlia Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit well and slides nicely under another shirt! Only adds slight warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Lovestosmile

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but will keep you warm
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Mom, a Florida transplant who moved into our home. After living in a warm climate for decades, Chicago winters were tough for her. We couldn't have the heat turned up to 80 in the winter, because we'd be miserable, not to mention the expense. So, this was the answer. Kept her warm without the rest of the household suffocating. Very lightweight and easy to layer under clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Fabric
customer_reviews.text: Lovely fabric. Keeps me warm in winter. Not too tight or too loose, just the perfect fit. I also like that the fabric is thin so i do not over heat. I use indoors mostly, but some buildings are unheated and others are hot, so this undershirt keeps me at the right temperature.
customer_reviews.author: ReneJ

customer_reviews.title: Checks all the boxes
customer_reviews.text: Comfy, warm and light, and it washed well (following the instructions of course! I hung it dry rather than risk it in the dryer).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice thermals
customer_reviews.text: So soft and light. It is see-through so it's great to wear while lounging at home. I have the leggings as well. Love them both.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice light fabric
customer_reviews.text: Easy to wear, comfortable. The fabric is thin but not totally transparent. I am wearing it under other clothing when I want to add sleeves to a garment; works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jane E Gebauer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for adding a little extra warmth without adding bulk, thus allowing me to wear that extra layer without substantially changing the fit of whatever I wear over it. I have found them useful for fall weather and mild winters. I haven't tested them beyond that. As one would expect from silk, the material is soft. If you pack light, and wash clothes in the sink, you can expect these to hang dry in a reasonable period of time. They do pick up a little static sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Happy with fit and fabic
customer_reviews.text: This silk top is just the ticket. Very light weight and nice that is long in length. Perfect base layer. I may try washing by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Material is rough but the undershirt is warm
customer_reviews.text: I found that the sleeves were very short on me. The material is rough and I was hoping it would be silky. I do love how warm these are, but the price is pretty high for what it’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Z.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well, and also features an unexpected bonus
customer_reviews.text: When viewed simply as a warming layer of undergarment, the Thermasilk performs exactly as it should. A very light, thin layer to add a few extra degrees on cold days and nights. One thing I didn't know about this material, but quickly found out when my wife wore it for the first time, is that the material is a little bit sheer. I'm not complaining, of course, but just to warn you, these won't work as a substitute for pajamas. They definitely must be worn underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.J.

customer_reviews.title: This top has been great. I've only worn it few times
customer_reviews.text: This top has been great. I've only worn it few times, but it has come in quite handy in cold weather. Its very thin but effective and comfortable. If you're going to an outdoor event and not sure just how cold it's going to get, it will fold up quite small and is easily packable into your purse so you can change into it later if needed.
customer_reviews.author: L3rob

customer_reviews.title: Extra large on a little person
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it was a lot cheaper than the LL Bean ones I had been ordering. It seemed to be about the same quality only the sizing is much smaller. It was also too short to tuck in which I like in a first layer shirt. Other than that these shirts are great. You can wear them under a sweater of knit shirt and they don't cling to the top layer. So loose fitting clothes over them don't creep up. It's unfortunate that they cheeped out and made them 4 inches too short.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep warm.  Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I saved the packaging to return this item. Doesn’t keep you warm at all... complete waist of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Ton

customer_reviews.title: I was toasty at the top yet comfortable and not overheated at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and warm -- just used it on a ski trip where the wind was howling at the top of the mountain and calmer at the base.. I was toasty at the top yet comfortable and not overheated at the bottom. Thin and easy to layer over
customer_reviews.author: Pri

customer_reviews.title: Figure out the price you will be charged
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would be paying less for this scoop than I was charged. I made my total order for more than $25.00 as I thought was as described for the lower price. But I was charged the full price.
customer_reviews.author: scwaldo

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these base layer bottoms for wearing under hiking pants. They fell apart in less than four months. Although they were comfortable, they did not hold up to daily use for hiking. They would probably be fine for light use around the house or office.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Terramar is tops for winter warmth !!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of these great Terra-mar tops before. I was so happy to see that AMAZON carried a whole line of TERRA MAR winter warmth items. I have looked at other brands but they never measured up.Ladies these are so silky and warm,just order your normal American size off their chart and you will be satisfied. Tried and true....These are the best for winter layering warmth.....treat yourself !!!
customer_reviews.author: Sparkles Spencer

customer_reviews.title: It was tissue thin silk (which is what I wanted) & very good quality. This makes a superb layer for cool ...
customer_reviews.text: The wrong size (LARGE) was shipped to me, although I ordered X-SMALL. The large was too big, but actually would probably not fit a very large person. So order next size UP unless you want it skin tight. I re-orederd a SMALL. It was tissue thin silk (which is what I wanted) & very good quality. This makes a superb layer for cool weather travel, where space in your bag is at a premium!
customer_reviews.author: Allison K

customer_reviews.title: Giving a 4 only because the fabric picks really easily.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for skiing. Giving a 4 only because the fabric picks really easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wash cold, do not dry
customer_reviews.text: This appears to have shrunk, but I followed the washing instructions. It’s disappointing because I did like it before the sleeves grew too short.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Love this wonderfully thin but warm undershirt
customer_reviews.text: Love this wonderfully thin but warm undershirt. Perfect to tuck into pants without adding bulk. I wear it under all my shirts & pullovers. It keeps the Winter chill off. The silk is much warmer than cotton & keeps me warm. Washes & drys well on low, gentle setting. It does snag on the hip area in the back when I tuck it into my jeans. That is my only complaint. I'll be purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Enzone

customer_reviews.title: Strongly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Whoa, this is cool. So thin, but once you put it on, it hugs you. Very similar to cuddling with your boyfriend on the couch while watching a funny movie, but without the awkwardness of having to readjust positions with another human to maintain comfort.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burgette

customer_reviews.title: The thermal sensation is really nice. not suffocating at all
customer_reviews.text: I already own 4 of these. The thermal sensation is really nice. not suffocating at all. They are light, so it won't warm you up much, but it is a great first layer. I use them from Autumn to Spring like a second skin. They are delicate so you have to treat them gently if you want them to last.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda RL

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but too lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice, except that they are tissue-paper thin and I needed heavyweight ones, so I had to return these. It would be good if in the product description they could describe them as feather light or something so consumers would know the weight.
customer_reviews.author: L. A.

customer_reviews.title: Thin, light & warm - great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: This takes a tiny amount of room & kept me nice & warm in the very cool mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Abbott

customer_reviews.title: See through thin
customer_reviews.text: See through mosquito screen thin Have yet to see how they retain warmth but not optimistic Will not be ordering the pants/lower half
customer_reviews.author: NG Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Breathable Well Made Pretty
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fabric and collar. After washing on hand wash in washing machine all seams are still intact. Lower hem is not bulky and cuffs on sleeve stay in place. It is lightweight yet gives warmth even at freezing temperatures - yes had shirt, sweater and down jacket but it gave that ease of wear with all these layers. It was breathable & not sticky as with other fibers on other thermal shirts I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Poodle Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love This Thermasilk Top
customer_reviews.text: Perfect light weight undergarment. It is just the right weight to fit under everything and add that extra layer of warmth. I'm 5'5", 130 pounds. Bought a small and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: DogMomTo2

customer_reviews.title: Good quality silk undergarment, at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: It is thin and fits close to the body precisely because it is meant to be used as a base layer and not on its own. Excellent under scratchy sweaters made of wool or other not so soft materials.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Duenas

customer_reviews.title: Not very long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Not very good quality. I ordered two of these, and it did not take long for them to rip and pill. I always washed these on the delicate setting in cold water and hung to dry. However, they are soft and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: jjc

customer_reviews.title: not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I would love to recommend this product as it feels nicely on your skin BUT the black labels leave marks even on the underwear and stain the top when washed. Definitely won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vera K

customer_reviews.title: I originally bought a medium after reading reviews that it ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a medium after reading reviews that it ran small. I found the medium too large for me and returned it for an extra small. I tried on my extra small last night and it fit me well. I normally wear a size 4.
customer_reviews.author: Evalynne G Elias

customer_reviews.title: Baggy, thin, not very warm unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: This is a little baggier than I had expected for a base layer. It is exceptionally thin. Has feminine detailing that some people might like and others wish it wasn't there. I find it doesn't keep me nearly as warm as other silk under layers. The quality seemed unremarkable. I tend to wear it for pyjamas instead of under clothes because of the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly thin, warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I layer one of these under my merino shirts and am cozy and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: too thin and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It is very flimsy. Did not expect this super light see thru shirt. I'd be surprised, if it survives the first wash. Adds very little warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Ute H. Riggin

customer_reviews.title: A little big and very thin, but somehow quite warm!
customer_reviews.text: The fit is a little larger than expected; I would've preferred the shirt to be more snug. Also the silk material is very very thin, and I hope it can stand up to gentle washing. I have to say though, for being so thin, I am surprised at the warmth it retains! I'll be wearing this all winter as my base layer for outdoor winter sports.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy70

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel !
customer_reviews.text: Kept me warm in Iceland! Lightweight and invisible under my fleece pullovers.
customer_reviews.author: jony

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it is just me, but this fabric is ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is just me, but this fabric is WAY too thin. Think almost spider-web-like, also see through. I did not find it particularly warm, therefore, returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: OldProf

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful material, easy to wear.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely silk layer. Easy to wear, smooth on the skin, perfect warming layer - very light adds no bulk. Only issue neckline a little high for buttoned blouses. Would prefer it was a lower neckline.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Light, warming, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I am very comfortable this winter and I notice a big difference in being comfortable when I wear it and feeling cool when I don’t.
customer_reviews.author: B. E. H.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful product
customer_reviews.text: This product is really great! It's super soft, machine washable, and provides a great insulating layer to keep you warm during the winter. It seems a little bit expensive, though that's to be expected with 100% silk. There was this weird situation though, where the different sizes came at a price difference of ten to twenty dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Kinneret Itzhak

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but completly shear
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be of great quality but be aware this is shear
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  Lightweight Silk Undershirt
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I bought one last year and got more this year. If you live in a cool area, this light weight silk undie will keep you a bit warmer if you wear it as an undershirt. You can use any silk blouse to keep you warm under clothing, but his is so light that you forget you are wearing it. Remember silk keeps you cool when it is hot out and warm when it is cold out. Better then wool.
customer_reviews.author: No. Cal.

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and high quality silk top.
customer_reviews.text: Its cold outside, but I am warm thanks to this silk top. Great product. This is the second one for me.
customer_reviews.author: ctomfin

customer_reviews.title: It May Not Be Silk
customer_reviews.text: I like these for layering up for work in the winter. They are nice and thin so my layers don't get too bulky. They do a gook job of keeping me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for under sweaters and blouses
customer_reviews.text: Sleeves too long and concern as to how they will hold up
customer_reviews.author: Patsy Baynard

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for in cold Chicago winters. It adds a layer of warmth without bulk. It has a pretty edging around the neck. The material is thin, so you need to take care that you don't snag it. Otherwise, just lovely!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and warm.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a friend who lives in NYC. She loves it and the longer length is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dagny Taggart

customer_reviews.title: Thin (see-thru!) but warm
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a thermal shirt that was thin and warm and this does it! Keep in mind, it's VERY thin...not exactly the best on it's own for a PJ top (especially if you get it in white, like I did) unless you're very comfortable around anyone who might be seeing you. My only complaints is that the neck is high enough that you can see the trim over basically any non-turtleneck sweater, and sometimes the cuffs too (but these can easily be rolled up).
customer_reviews.author: MrTed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for under form fitting clothing
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and thin enough to wear under a formfitting garment, yet still provides warmth. Just take care as the fabric snags easily.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great silk undershirt
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'7.5" and 128-130lbs and the small fits great. Washes well and you can wear it a few times before washing. I also bought a medium in white. I like the small better, but both work well.
customer_reviews.author: Cristine J. Kosnik

customer_reviews.title: Only OK
customer_reviews.text: The silk is very thin and thready. I suppose that is what Pointelle means. I didn't know what it meant and ordered it assuming it was smooth silk. It's okay for the price........but not worth more than that.
customer_reviews.author: A Northwest reader

customer_reviews.title: Light weight. Keeps me warm!,
customer_reviews.text: This Thermasilk top keeps me warm under my sweaters or sweatshirts. It very important to layer during the Winter to retain body heat. Even though it is very light and sheer it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Longshadow

customer_reviews.title: Very thin
customer_reviews.text: Very very thin and not very durable. It looks like sheer underwear that can tear any second. No durability. Will not repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: shoebox36

customer_reviews.title: I bought the larger size which isn't too bad - somewhat loose
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews, I bought the larger size which isn't too bad - somewhat loose. Both this top and the camisole are quite long and there seems to be a lot of extra material. However, it does help keep your core warm under lighter weight clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Wandra Harmsen

customer_reviews.title: Sheer, but toasty
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot more sheer ("see through") than in the photo. However, this shirt really works and is a great, comfy base layer for hiking in areas where the weather changes quickly from warm to cool.

product_meta.description:
Terramar ec2 Filament Pointelle Silk is an ideal base layer supple and sumptuous, this luxurious natural silk knit boasts an attractively-shaped pattern. It's lightweight yet surprisingly strong, with natural stretch for all day comfort.

These shirts are very light weight and do not have additional bulk and made with our ClimaSense treatment to neutralize odors, regulate your body temperature and wick away any sweat.

Terramar Sports is a United States based company making base layer gear for the most extreme outdoors person. Our products are created for every day adventures to difficult snowshoeing and mountain climbing. Keeping you warm is our job!
